greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-q) * phi(-q^2) * phi(-q^3) * phi(-q^6) in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q)^2 * eta(q^2) * eta(q^3)^2 * eta(q^6) / (eta(q^4) * eta(q^12)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (24 t)) = 384 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A033765.
mathematica: eta[q_]:= q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[eta[q]^2* eta[q^2]*eta[q^3]^2*eta[q^6]/(eta[q^4]*eta[q^12]), {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 18 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^3 + A)^2 * eta(x^6 + A) / (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^12 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 01 2014
